result.execSummary:
The defendant Sandra M. Bearrunner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: In the event probation is revoked, Defendant would be entitled to Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. The defendant is to have NO CONFRONTATIONAL/ARGUMENTATIVE contact with the victim as named in the complaint.

Defendant is to comply with any rules/recommendations as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.   DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed. Defendant is to complete an Anger Management course as prescribed by the supervising agent.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sandra M. Bearrunner

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Order for reimbursement of GAL or Attorney

records.addlTxt: 9:55 am case called. Defendant Sandra M. Bearrunner in court with attorney Matthew Loren Goldin.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Resolution reached and stated on the record.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: No Contest to Count 2.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Court dismisses and reads-in Count 1. Court sentences the defendant to: 60 days WCJ, STAYED and placed on probation for a period of 18 months. If revoked, with Huber and GT credit. Credit for 1 day served. CONDITIONS: AODA & Follow through,   The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. Anger Management as prescribed by supervision agent. No argumentative contact with victim. Costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan, to include Attorney Goldin's fees & DNA surcharge. DNA sample. Appeal Rights Given.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Defendant Sandra M. Bearrunner in court, in person, with attorney Matthew Loren Goldin, appearing via telephone.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  STC adjourned - NOH given.  Counsel will conduct a PTC prior to return for STC.  Status conference scheduled for August 4, 2015 at 09:45 am.
from DE advising that she is unable to make atty fee deposit by the ordered date - the court will address at the next hearing

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

Case Called @ 2:49 PM: Defendant Sandra M. Bearrunner in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel.  Def wants counsel - spoke with SPD prior to going of record and does not qualify for services.  Upon earnings discussions, Court willing to appoint counsel.  No later than 6/5/15 deposit of $250 to be paid.  $50 per mo PP to commence on 7/1/2015.  NGP entered by Court.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Status conference scheduled for June 29, 2015 at 02:15 pm.
